posts.title: Our Year in Review, and What’s Ahead
posts.headline: Our Year in Review, and What’s Ahead
posts.subhead: As 2024 comes to a close, we wanted to take a moment to reflect on what we achieved in this last year. Our community has continued to drive the development of CodeEdit. We're especially excited to share what we worked on, and what's coming for CodeEdit!
posts.description: As 2024 comes to a close, we wanted to take a moment to reflect on what we achieved in this last year.

author.name: Khan Winter
author.bio: iOS, macOS, Embedded Systems Dev | University of Minnesota - Computer Engineering | Apple 2020 Student Developer Challenge Winner | Working on @CodeEditApp

posts.title: Writing a Generic Fuzzy Search Algorithm in Swift
posts.headline: Writing a Generic Fuzzy Search Algorithm in Swift
posts.subhead: Fuzzy searching finds matches even if there are spelling mistakes or slight variations in the search terms. It helps improve search accuracy by understanding what the user is likely looking for.
posts.description: Fuzzy searching finds matches even if there are spelling mistakes or slight variations in the search terms. It helps improve search accuracy by understanding what the user is likely looking for.

author.name: Tom Ludwig
author.bio: Coding in Swift, Dart, Go, Rust, and C++. SwiftUI first, with Flutter when the situation calls for it.

posts.title: Why We're Building CodeEdit: A Natively-built Code Editor for the Mac
posts.headline: Why We're Building CodeEdit: A Natively-built Code Editor for the Mac
posts.subhead: It might sound crazy, but we are determined to build an editor native to macOS written in Swift, by the community, for the community. Completely open source and free forever.
posts.description: It might sound crazy, but we are determined to build an editor native to macOS written in Swift, by the community, for the community. Completely open source and free forever.

author.name: Austin Condiff
author.bio: I create beautiful user interfaces and interactive experiences. I organized and am currently working on @CodeEditApp.
